sys_hub_action_type_definition.copied_from_name: Copy of Get All Jobs From Folder
sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
This action retrieves all the jobs for a given folder from Jenkins Server. The retrieved information will have Class and Name of each job based on the given depth.

Inputs:

  • Depth - Number of levels to traverse to retrieve job details.
  • Folder Path - Name of the folder from which to retrieve all the jobs.Provide full path if your Folder is under another folder. E.g. UAT-Test/SNOW

Outputs:

  • Job List - Will be set to the list of jobs retrieved from folder.
  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • Folder path doesn't exist or not accessible.
  • Provided Folder Path is not a Folder Path but a Job Path.
  • Provided value for Folder Path does not exist or invalid.
  • You do not have enough permissions to perform this action in Jenkins server.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Additional Notes:

  • Ensure that depth value should be greater than 0.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
This action retrieves all the jobs for a given folder from Jenkins Server. The retrieved information will have Class and Name of each job based on the given depth.

Inputs:

  • Depth - Number of levels to traverse to retrieve job details.
  • Folder Path - Name of the folder from which to retrieve all the jobs.Provide full path if your Folder is under another folder. E.g. UAT-Test/SNOW

Outputs:

  • Job List - Will be set to the list of jobs retrieved from folder.
  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • Folder path doesn't exist or not accessible.
  • Provided Folder Path is not a Folder Path but a Job Path.
  • Provided value for Folder Path does not exist or invalid.
  • You do not have enough permissions to perform this action in Jenkins server.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Additional Notes:

  • Ensure that depth value should be greater than 0.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
